title: "Canton" dinner plate
text: In Paris around 1900, a source for forward-thinking furnishings was Siegfried Bing's Parisian Gallery, La Maison Art Nouveau Bing.  Colonna served as one of the shop's in-house designers.  This plate's name and subtly incised decoration suggests Colonna drew inspiration from Chinese porcelain, which Westerners purchased for centuries at the port of Canton.
description: Cream plate with raised swirled decoration in center and edges with green border
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
